name: Record-Journal-ThingstoDoCalendar
0:
”Alexa, ask Record Journal what's happening.”
”Alexa, ask Record Journal what's going on this weekend.”
”Alexa, ask Record Journal what's happening in Wallingford, Connecticut on Saturday morning.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: record journal
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Interactive access to all of the local event listings in Central Connecticut and beyond from the Record-Journal based on your location, radius, day, or time.

To get started, all you have to say is, “Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s happening” or “Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s going on.”

You can also specify a location, radius and day or time. Some example phrases are below:
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s going on tonight.
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s happening tomorrow afternoon.
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s happening this weekend.
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s going on next weekend in Austin, Texas.
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s going on in Boulder, Colorado on Saturday morning.
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s happening in Madison, Wisconsin on March 28.
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s happening within five miles of Santa Rosa, California.
Alexa, ask Record Journal what’s going on tomorrow within ten miles of Provo, Utah.

Permissions:
*Device Address. Your device address will be used to provide responses with events local to your area.

Tips:
*If not otherwise specified, you will get today’s events.
*Allowing access to your device location allows that to be your default location, when no location is specified.
*To help Alexa understand what you say, it can be helpful to slightly pause after some words such as “ask”, and your city name.
*To help Alexa identify your specified city, be sure to include the state as well.
*To refine your results, you may specify time ranges such as morning, afternoon, or evening.
*To refine your results you may include a date or date range such as December 9, tomorrow, this weekend, next Friday, or next weekend.

Find more event details, create an account, or submit an event at http://www.myrecordjournal.com/things-to-do/
